DOC.detailed_description: When donor cornea remove person die , prepared transplantation eye bank . The donor cornea place liquid help preserve cornea transplant . The Food Drug Administration ( FDA ) approve storage cornea liquid 14 day transplant . The purpose study see length time donor cornea keep preservation liquid transplant affect likelihood transplant successful . We follow participant 3 year transplant see difference transplant success number transplant endothelial cell ( layer cell line undersurface cornea ) corneas preserved 7 day less compare preserve 8 14 day . We reason believe great risk transplant failure either preservation time group .
DOC.criteria: Study Participant Eligibility Criteria Study Participant Inclusion Criteria 1 . Age range 30 < 91 year minimum life expectancy least 3 year . 2 . Willingness return followup study visit 1 day , 1 week , 1 month , 6 month , 1 year , 2 year 3 year . 3 . Fluent English Spanish . Study Participant Exclusion Criteria 1 ) Decisionally and/or cognitively impaired Study Eye Eligibility Criteria Study Eye Inclusion Criteria 1 . EK schedule 10 60 day enrollment The 10day requirement relates need able randomly assign eye either intervention group . The 60day requirement relates need current eligibility enrollment data time surgery . If surgery postpone > 60 day initial enrollment visit , new Baseline Visit eligibility assessment perform . 2 . Presence condition relate endothelial dysfunction treat EK . Eligible indication EK include : Presence FECD meeting least one following : Phakic FECD Phakic FECD cataract Triple procedure include EK FECD , cataract extraction posterior chamber intraocular lens implantation ( IOL ) allow Aphakic FECD Pseudophakic FECD posterior capsule support , suturefixated , sulcussupported posterior chamber IOL Aphakic pseudophakic corneal edema posterior capsule support , suturefixated , sulcussupported posterior chamber IOL without FECD Study Eye Exclusion Criteria 1 . Prior EK 2 . Indication surgery suitable EK ( e.g , keratoconus , stromal dystrophy scar ) 3 . Presence condition high probability failure ( e.g. , fail EK PKP , heavily vascularize cornea , uncontrolled uveitis ) 4 . Other primary endothelial dysfunction condition include posterior polymorphous corneal dystrophy congenital hereditary corneal dystrophy 5 . Anterior chamber IOL study eye prior anticipate EK 6 . Planned intraocular lens exchange anterior chamber IOL posterior chamber IOL study eye time study EK 7 . Preoperative central subepithelial stromal scar investigator believe visually significant could impact postoperative stromal clarity assessment 8 . Stromal vascularization visually significant ( investigator 's judgment ) 9 . Presence anterior synechiae ( iris cornea ) 10 . Peripheral anterior synechiae ( iris angle ) angle great total three clock hour 11 . Hypotony ( Intraocular pressure < 10 mm Hg ) 12 . Uncontrolled ( defined intraocular pressure > 25mm Hg ) glaucoma without prior filtering surgery shunt minishunt placement . A shunt minishunt device implant low intraocular pressure external route ( e.g Ahmed ) internal route ( e.g . Glaukos ) present anterior chamber angle extend anterior chamber . 13 . Controlled glaucoma prior shunt minishunt placement glaucoma Note : FECD pseudophakic/aphakic corneal edema posterior chamber IOL also undergone filter surgery ( without shunt minishunt ) glaucoma currently consider control eligible 14 . Fellow eye visual acuity < 20/200 correctable EK Eligibility Criteria Second Study Eye 1 . Study participant already enrol one eye 2 .
